info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:17AM EDT until April 8 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
.Heavy rainfall across central Indiana from several events over the past week has brought minor to significant flooding to several rivers, creeks and streams in central Indiana. Most of these smaller watersheds should all be back below flood stage by Tuesday morning, but Sugar Creek at Edinburgh may stay above flood stage until Tuesday night. Major flooding in several locations along the mainstem rivers will continue through the week.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Sugar Creek in southern Hancock and western Shelby Counties. After reaching this level, and when the Big Blue River was near 16.5 feet, one day later several homes along the creek west of Shelbyville were evacuated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EDT Monday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1145 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
